entry.title: Reverse Engineering the source code of the BioNTech/Pfizer SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine
entry.quote: The BNT162b mRNA vaccine has this digital code at its heart. It is 4284 characters long, so it would fit in a bunch of tweets. At the very beginning of the vaccine production process, someone uploaded this code to a DNA printer (yes), which then converted the bytes on disk to actual DNA molecules.

entry.title: How the US government hack happened, and what it means, explained by an expert
entry.quote: It’s one of the largest and most brazen hacks in American history — and it may just be the beginning of a much larger global espionage effort.

entry.title: Why @Google fired me
entry.quote: I'm finna tell yall why @Google fired me- their MOST successful diversity recruiter in the history of their company- with the receipts to support that statement.

entry.title: New Yorker Photography in a Year of Crisis
entry.quote: Among the many extraordinary challenges posed by 2020 were a few that were peculiar to photographers. When the pandemic hit, journalists who write for a living could conduct much of their reporting remotely, by phone or over Zoom, but photographers documenting the ravages of covid-19 had to go to the action—or at least within six feet of it.
